summary:

descriptionHtml:
Cities RnE-Solitude
Reduced n Enhanced (RnE) packages by Thorne67
Made for FPS Boosts on low end machines
Download - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/40192

NEXUS EXCLUSIVE.
NON MESHED VERSION. NO REQUIREMENTS. NO ESP

Ok. First of all. Running low rez textures on low 
settings just WONT work well.  The best way to 
use THESE is to download a Low rez pack such as 
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/47 
or 
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/14504 
and overwrite these and whatever other mods on 
top of them and THEN change your graphics settings 
to a higher value with CONFIGURATOR at
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/814.

\"WHO SAYZ LOW REZ SUX??\"

All custom and redone from UHD original textures and individually converted to 512k and re-edited. Well... as low res as possible for all items without losing too much. Solitude had some very beautiful textures that worked very well at lower resolutions. Images are from Version 1 and not very advanced.

I take no credits for original works. I\'ve just re-done them for FPS boosts and for use on low end machines. 

No extra crap goes into the skyrim folder with my mods.

This is my first of upload of a batch of redone Cities textures by me.
RnE Farmhouses- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/40075
RnE Winterhold- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/40127
RnE Whiterun- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/40080
RnE Solutude- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/40192
RnE Riften- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3761688
RnE Falmerhuts Tents Edgetrim- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3761688
RnE Hrothgar- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3761688
RnE Markarth- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3761688
RnE Skyhaventemple- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3761688
RnE Sovngarde- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3761688
RnE Windhelm- http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3761688

Most all of my files use WinRAR with maximum compression and a +2 or +3 percent recovery record so if you get a hiccup in your net connection you can probably do a safe recover instead of downloading the entire file again.
author: Thorne67
